result.execSummary:
The defendant David F. Eddy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Revoked (Misdemeanor)], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Payable at the rate of $50.00 per month, starting on or before August 1, 2016 and on the same day each month thereafter, until paid in full.    Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.  $15.00 payment plan fee added.
Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

ADDRESS INFO for David F. Eddy
Current: PO Box 44, Merrillan, WI 54754 United States  (Effective: 11-10-2017)
Prior: 203 N East Street, Merrillan, WI 54754
Arrest-Bench Warrant FTP Capias/Letter

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Poss.  Defendant plead no contest to Counts 2 and 3 in 16CM28.  15CT92, 16TR576,  and Count 1 in 16CM28 dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.  Court recited the charges and possible penalties on the counts he plead to.  Defendant understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the pleas.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, and intelligently entered his pleas and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, contrary to 947.01(1) and OAR, contrary to 343.44(1)(b).  Joint recommendation.  $100.00 fine plus costs each charge. $958.00 total, including 1 DNA surcharge.    Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.  Pay @ $50.00 per month starting 8/1.    Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 18, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Attorney SPD William Poss appears on behalf of the defendant.  Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Will be set for plea.  TR case is to track with criminal cases.  Attorney Poss to schedule with JA.

Pre-trial conference on May 11, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on June 6, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with  Attorney Poss.  Waive the reading of the complaint.  Defendant stood mute.  NGP entered by court.  PTC set for 5/11 and STC set for 6/6 at 3 pm.  Bond continued.  Track civil citations.  NGP entered by court on civil citations.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 18, 2016 at 09:00 am.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and without counsel.  He is going to hire Attorney Stichert.  Needs his tax refund.  AIA set for 4/18/16 at 9 am.  Defendant to be booked today.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 4, 2016 at 09:00 am.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and without counsel.  Court advised the charges.  Court advised the defendant of the attorney options.  He will apply for SPD.  AIA set for 4/4/16 at 9 am.
Defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County Jail.
DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County Jail.  Cash bond set.  AIA set for 3/21/16 at 9 am.

This cash bond covers cases 15CT92 and 16CM28:  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 21, 2016 at 09:00 am.
